text: We're there Stepek, right on target ... Rabual dead ahead! Suddenly a cacophony of explosions split the air as anti- shells explode ahead of the aircraft, lighting the inside electric blue flashes.
Gee!  Thanks for telling me, Holden.  I thought it was Cleveland.
Ackack guns blast shells skyward.  The gun blasts light u the palm tree background, causing momentary silhouettes.
For Christ sake, hold her steady!
He can be seen from outside the plane as the shell flashe light up his turret.
Quit yer bitching Stepek, just drop 'em and let's get outta here!
Keep your shirts on guys, tonight I'm gonna hit something. (he settles over the bomb sight) Left two degrees ... steady ... steady ...
The flak is severe, with electric blue flashes lighting u the fuselage interior.
Hey kid, how ya doing back there?
Tailgunner momentarily lit with a shell burst, he's scare shitless.  He looks nervously back behind the aircraft at the flak puffs behind the tail.
Gulp, ah ... I'm ah ... okay ... I think.
Button it up, we're almost there.
He is crouched over his bomb-sights, concentrating.
C'mon Stepek, there's the whole island of Rabaul down there, you can't miss!
Screw you ...
Suddenly a shell explodes almost on the windshield and th pilot rears back with the blast.  The right windshield is shattered.
We took a hit ... The co-pilot sags forward, held back only by his shoulder straps.  His eyes stare.  Blood runs from under his helme We know he is dead.
Shit.  Elkhorn just bought it.
We took one back here too. C'mon Stepek, blast 'em!
(hand on the release button)
Steady ... steady ... bombs away! Let's get the hell outta here!

We hear the shriek of descending bombs.  The explosions w across the airfield, and in the light of the explosions w see devastation.  The last bomb hits a fuel dump, causing enormous ball of fire. BOMBARDIER (V.O.)
Yahoo!  Bullseye!
PILOT (exhilarated)
Nice shooting Stepek, how are the rest of you guys? FLIGHT ENGINEER (V.O.)
Flight Engineer okay. RADIO OPERATOR (V.O.)
Radio okay. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)
Navigator check. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)
Belly okay. TAILGUNNER (V.O.)
Ah ... tail okay ... There is abrupt silence. PILOT
Bellson ... Lewis? Still silence, no reply from either name. PILOT
Kid, check the waist positions, see if they're okay.
TAILGUNNER
Yeah ... will do, skipper. TAILGUNNER crosses himself, then exits back into the body the machine.
PILOT (wearily)
Let's go home. We hear jumbled comments from all positions.  Everyone is happy. CREW (V.O.)
Cheers and whoops. The mood of high spirits is stopped abruptly as the tailg reports back. TAILGUNNER (V.O.)
Skipper, Bellson and Lewis are both dead. This is the first time the kid's voice is not scared, jus puzzled. PILOT
Dammit! BOMBARDIER (V.O.)
Well kid, now you got a real bombing mission under your belt.
He removes his oxygen mask and takes a long swig from a bottle.
She rejoins the rest of the group.  The formation is not quite as tight as before.  As the formation flies along, puffs of cloud pass by, occasionally obscuring a machine.

Under the "Pacific Pearl's" belly, we see the bellygunner suspended in his small glass pod.  A red glow brightens u as he drags on a cigar.  The rest of the formation are visible stretched to the side and behind as puffs of clou waft past.  We begin to feel as if the weather might be changing.
The BOMBARDIER is relaxing inside as he swigs from the bo and sings raucously.  From the front we look in on the pi with the dead co-pilot sagging in his seat next to him. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)
Sorry about Elkhorn, skip. What happened? PILOT
I dunno.  The shell exploded and he collapsed.  I think he took it in the head. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)
Are ya sure he's dead, Skipper? PILOT
He's dead. BOMBARDIER (sings drunkenly)
Oh I put my finger in a woodpecker's hole and the woodpecker said God bless my soul; take it out, take it out, take it out, remove it ... TAILGUNNER (bolder)
Hey Stepek, just shut up, okay? BOMBARDIER

Up yours kid, wassa matter, you don't like my voice? While all this banter has been going on the cloud has bee thickening.  Suddenly a serious voice cuts in on the smal talk. It's the NAVIGATOR. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)
Something's wrong!
He is frantically tapping the compass. PILOT (V.O.)
You got a problem, Holden? BOMBARDIER (V.O.)
Naw, the kid's the one with the problem.  He don't like my voice! PILOT (V.O.)
Button it up Stepek.  What's the problem, Holden? NAVIGATOR
I must have a malfunction, my compass says we're heading north!
He looks at his compass. PILOT
Mine says east. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)
Hey, can you guys see the rest of the squadron? BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)
Negative, there's too much cloud. A sudden flash of lightning illuminates the whole inside the plane.
The dead co-pilot's pale face is momentarily electric blu lit by the lightning flash.  We pan past him to the compa the instrument panel.  It is spinning madly. PILOT
What the hell ... He reaches forward to tap the compass. PILOT
Hey Holden, now my compass has gone crazy.  It's spinning like a son of a bitch! NAVIGATOR (V.O.)
Mine too, we must have hit a magnetic field or something !!
We see a dull glow coming from all crew positions from th on-board lights.  Suddenly a curtain of rain lashes the m PILOT (V.O.)
Christ, now they're all doing it!!
All the dials are going haywire.  Above the instrument pa we see the windshield is spattered with rain. BOMBARDIER (V.O.)
You guys quit talking business? I'm trying to sing here!  Oh I put my finger in a woodpecker's ... PILOT (irritably)
Can it Stepek, we got real problems. Just then through the rain, a strange green glow is seen in the distance.  It begins to curve toward the aircraft.
The turret swings as the gunner spots the glow. BELLYGUNNER
Jesus!  Look at that!! From under the starboard wing, we see the object approach PILOT (V.O.)
Look at what ... look at what!!? BELLYGUNNER
It's out there, just look at it ... PILOT (V.O.)
For Christ sake, give us a position! BELLYGUNNER
It's about four o'clock, just below ... Holy Shit, it's coming right at us! The glow suddenly zooms at the plane with great speed and the starboard inner engine.

He has to push the dead co-pilot back to peer out the broken starboard window ... the number three prop is bent and windmilling wildly.  It has a strange green luminesce about it ... the whole machine shakes. PILOT
Damn. The PILOT tries to fly the plane and do the co-pilot's jo feathering the bad engine.  Suddenly it's too late as the wobbles loose and cartwheels over the wing.
The prop flies back and slices a great gash in the aircra skin, near the TAILGUNNER'S position.
PILOT
We lost the goddamned prop ... Did it do any damage?  Kid, check the tail. Silence. PILOT
Come in kid ... kid are you okay? Silence. PILOT
Travis; go check the back. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)
Will do, skipper.
TRAVIS' turret opens and TRAVIS pulls himself up into the
The gauges are now settled except for the oil pressure to No. 2 engine.  The pressure drops.  The engine heat gauge climbs rapidly.  A red warning light begins to flash. PILOT (to himself)

Goddamn it, now what? He glances out of his window just in time to see a strang claw-like feeler coming out of the engine casing.  It det one of the cooling gills, then another, and another.  The away in the slipstream. PILOT
Gremlins! (rubbing his eyes) Jesus, I must be getting tired.

He looks in to the kid's reargun compartment.  All that i of him is a tattered skeleton. TRAVIS turns, horror frozen on his face.  Quick as a flas from seemingly nowhere, something flies at him and grabs throat.  The mask on his face falls off, and we get a spl second look of abject horror as he falls out of frame. PILOT (V.O.)
Travis, what's goin' on back there?
His eyes are open but he is obviously dead.  Through his headphone, we hear his name.
PILOT
Holden, how far to base? NAVIGATOR (V.O.)
Skip, with everything screwed up here, I'd, I'd guess about two hundred miles. All the time the engine pops and bangs wildly. PILOT
For Christ's sake, find us a place I can put her down!
NAVIGATOR
It's all ocean down there, skip!
PILOT
Mack, can you get us a radio fix?
RADIO OPERATOR
Negative skip, too much interference.
He is fighting the controls. PILOT
Shit!  I've gotta put her down!
BOMBARDIER
Hey Holden ... ya old stuff shirt ... ya wanna snort? PILOT (V.O.)

For God sakes Stepek, shut up! STEPEK takes another swig from his bottle.  He is lying o his back partly propped up by the curving nose of the air He is about to make another smart ass reply, when he hear strange scratching and chirping noise above his head.  He looks up in time to see sharp teeth and claws start to ap through the lining above his head.  He blinks in disbelie throws his bottle away as if the image came from the whis BOMBARDIER
Oh my God, there's ... there's ... ahh ... keep away ... keep away ... (struggles) ... hey no ... hey somebody ... (screams) NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

Stepek, you stupid sonovabitch, will you lay off the booze, you've got the D.T.'s ... STEPEK is wide-eyed and scared silly as the sound now beg under his feet and pincers begin to snip through the floo He suddenly realizes that the whole floor is giving way b him, and he grabs for a handful of cables as the floor co
The lower half of STEPEK is hanging in the slipstream, ki madly.  We see that his legs are covered in wriggling cre
He is losing his grip with one hand, but still desperatel clinging on to a bunch of cables with the other.  Suddenl an ugly pincer cuts the cables and STEPEK is gone ... out into the night.

Suddenly the No. 2 engine begins to backfire, blasting ba large gobs of orange flame.  The oil, heat and manifold g are off the dial and red lights frantically flash.  Despe the PILOT looks out of the window. Pieces begin flying off the engine.  The cowling disinteg revealing the bare engine beneath.  Small figures are fra busy ripping the engine to pieces.
He is scared. PILOT
Holden, for God's sake get up here on the double. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)
What's the problem, skip? PILOT
Just get up here! The NAVIGATOR grimaces as he pushes past the dead co-pilo NAVIGATOR
What is it, skip? (looking out windows)
PILOT

Hold 'em off.  I'm taking her down. He peers out at the incredible sight of the creatures rip off the wing skin and tearing huge plates from the cowlin The camera pans down to his feet as the hatch door handle and then bursts open.  A dozen bat-like creatures swarm i The NAVIGATOR panics and reaches up, grabbing the flare g from its rack.  He screams as the creatures attack and sh right through the creatures, bathing the aircraft with a ruby glow. NAVIGATOR (struggling)
Okay you little bastards ... shit ... (screams)
The flare shoots down the fuselage and smashes into him. Wreathed in flames, he falls back into the fuselage.

Creatures swarm all over the plane.  The ball turret fall off.  A wheel suddenly lowers, then falls off.  A flap fl free and blows away.  Oil streams back into the slipstrea sections of the skin of the plane come away, revealing th skeleton framework of the fuselage.

He is fighting the controls.  Creatures are now in the co plucking out the instruments.  The PILOT reaches to the t only to grab a creature that locks on to his gloved hand. Flying the plane with his good hand, he strikes and pumme at the attacking creatures with the other.
It is now almost a flying skeleton.  For the first time, see that it is heading for an island.  A figure detaches from the machine and plummets away.
He falls, terror-stricken, through space.  Finally his ch opens.  A slimy creature still clings to his gloved hand. off the glove and throws it and the creature away. PILOT
(struggling) Jesus H. Christ!

The approaching smoking plane bellies onto the sea, bounc then skims along the wave tops, careening up onto the bea where it twists around crazily before coming to a lopside stop.  The machine faces us head-on and we see a glow com from what's left of No. 3 engine. The camera zooms in rap to a green ball stuck in engine No. 3.

He has landed, and is undoing his parachute harness.  He around incredulously.  The island is a junkyard - a verit graveyard of aircrafts.  There are many aircrafts, both o wrecks and futuristic-looking ones lying everywhere.  Ske corpses are still left in some of the wrecks.  The camera to the remains of one machine.  It is an old American Loc Electra.  It glints dull in the half light of dawn.  Pain on its side are two names; "Amelia Earhart" and "Fred Noo The camera continues to move through this panorama of met junk until it stops on a long chrome rod sticking up out a pile of scrap. Tilting up to the sky we see the clouds part as two garga metal arms emerge and descend down toward the junkpile. metal arms reach the chrome rod, grip it tightly, and beg lift it up. WWe follow as the cylinder is pulled higher and higher, f coming to a stop in front of a giant eyeball.  The camera back to reveal that the eyeball belongs to AUSTIN GRIMALD who carefully scrutinizes the orange diode held tightly i needlenose pliers. AUSTIN
Got it. Satisfied that this is the piece he had lost in the machi he begins to re-solder it in place.  Behind him, a LITTLE GIRL with red hair comes into the room and walks up to hi LITTLE GIRL
It's broken again, isn't it Daddy? AUSTIN (concentrating)
Yes dear.  But Daddy's fixing it.  (hums) LITTLE GIRL (watching)
How come it's always breaking? AUSTIN
I don't know, sweetheart.  Mmmmhmm. LITTLE GIRL
When it's fixed, will you make more funny pictures for me? AUSTIN
Honey, why don't you go play with your toys and let Daddy finish his work, okay?  Mmmm ... LITTLE GIRL

Okay. The LITTLE GIRL wanders around to the other side of the m as AUSTIN flips a switch.  Once again the glass sphere sp and the holographic screen lights up.  AUSTIN uses a tool fine-tune the holograph and an image begins to materializ the glass gates of Kraan. As the image becomes clearer, the camera pulls closer and to the holograph screen.

The Council's voices still ringing in her head, TAARNA fl in over the demolished gates.  Below her, the once-beauti city lies in ruins. Gliding overtop the deserted streets, she sees a column o smoke rising through the wrecked dome of the building in town's center.  As she watches the smoke rise, she pulls on the reins, and heads her bird up. The camera follows as she rides in through the shattered down to the Council Chambers below. Corpses of the Councilmen are strewn everywhere.  In the center of the room, a large pile of ancient books and manuscripts lie smouldering.  Reaching the floor, TAARNA dismounts and starts to look around.  At the head of the marble table sits the ELDER - dead.  In front of him, a roll of parchment lies on the table.  TAARNA opens it. Carefully painted on the parchment is a circle of mountai their tops glowing green. TAARNA looks at it, and puts it in her sack.  Then she no that the ELDER is clutching something in his hand.  Pryin his stiff fingers apart, she finds a blood-stained medall just like the one her attacker wore on his chain. Looking at the dead ELDER, TAARNA grips the medallion tig in her hand.

TAARNA flies back out through the shattered dome and surv the city below.  All is quiet and dark, except for a gree coming from a second-floor window.  Curious, she flies ov pulls up beside the window, and climbs in.

Entering, TAARNA sees the slimy silk-like cocoon on the b The basket of fruit still sits on the floor.  From within the webbing, the green ball is glowing brightly. TAARNA looks at the parchment in her sack, then at the gl coming from the cocoon.  Cautiously, she approaches the c sword drawn. Suddenly a hand from within the cocoon grabs the ball and shoots forward, ripping through the webbing and holding t ball up to TAARNA's face.  The hand belongs to a hideousl ugly witch, who emerges from the cocoon, cackling through snake-like fangs. WITCH

Behold!  The Sphere of Uluhtec! Look upon it, Taarna.  Look upon it with fear.  For in its glow lies the end of heaven - the beginning of hell.  Take it Taarna.  Feel  death in your hands.  For death is upon you.  And as  you perish ... so dies your race! The witch's eyes go green. WITCH (screaming)

Take it !! She hurls tha ball at TAARNA, who dodges it.  The ball sa past her, out the window.  Then TAARNA, sword raised, lea at the WITCH, slicing through her in rapid strokes. The WITCH cackles and crumbles into dust, but her green e stay suspended in the air, and her cackle echoes through the room. TAARNA backs away, climbing out the window, onto her bird she flies off, she sees the WITCH'S green ball high above rising into the clouds and disappearing.

The WITCH'S green ball zooms through space, as Earth appe in the distance.  Then another object comes into sight. closer we see that is is a modern winged rocketplane of n determinable nationality, soaring high above Earth.  The meteorite passes, briefly bathing the rocketplane in its The rocketplane banks sharply, then stabilizes.  Slowly t hatch-doors in its belly open up, revealing the underside an automobile suspended in the open hatch. Hydraulic metal arms emerge, lowering the automobile out the belly of the cruising rocketplane.  We can see now that the car is a white, '59 Corvette convertible. With a "thunk", the metal arms release the car, and as the rocketplane blasts away, the Corvette begins its free-fall to Earth. As the car falls gracefully through space, the driver pla with the wheel, causing the Corvette to bank smoothly one way, then the other. Once his direction is stable, the driver clicks on the ca radio and adjusts it through various channels, until he s on one. With the music playing, the car falls closer and closer t Earth, entering and emerging from the cloud cover over th atmosphere.  In the heat of entry the vehicle's paint sta burning up. As he heads down over a deserted area, the driver begins approach.  Touching down at breakneck speed, the smoking Corvette bounces violently, every part straining at the repeated impact. The driver's face is expressionless as he jams the car in high gear and floors it, spinning the wheels in an attemp to translate downward momentum into forward motion.  Then he pops his drag chute to help slow down. TThis accomplished, the expressionless driver releases th chute, and speeds off down the road in a cloud of dust.

From high above the building we see a crowd of reporters and T.V. newsmen waiting on the front steps. The '59 Corvette pulls up at the curb below, and seeing it, the reporters all start to run over. The camera zooms down and into the car.  Inside, the driv reaches over, unplugs a rubber hose, and loosens the two large hex-nuts which connect him to the car.  As he gets the reporters come running up. FEMALE REPORTER (to driver)

Doctor Anrak, six more mutants were sighted in Arizona this morning.  Do you still say this has nothing to do with the green radiation from space. The driver walks on without speaking. T.V. NEWSMAN (walking alongside)

Doctor, is it true that the President himself pulled you off the Jupiter Six Project so that you could investigate those mutations? Doctor, answer me that. He ignores the question, and walks past the guard into th Pentagon.

Around a large table sit the Joint Chiefs of Staff, membe the Cabinet, and a pretty secretary wearing a tight skirt An argument is in progress as the expressionless DOCTOR A enters.  The camera follows him as he sits down next to o of the Generals. FAT POLITICIAN

... well what I wanna know is, what's the Army doing about this? Hell!  My constiuents are turning green!  They're growing arms on their backs.  There's something or someone up there in space and the voters have a right to know about it! GENERAL

Senator, we have no proof that these mutations are the result of interference from outer space.  In fact, Doctor Anrak has just come in, so let's hear what he has to say ... Doctor? The room goes silent as the DOCTOR stands up. DOCTOR

First of all, there is no cause for alarm.  As for the theories of interference by alien beings, it is my firm opinion that we on Earth are the only intelligent, technically advanced civilization present in the universe.
An enormous round spaceship the size of Pittsburg hovers overhead.
DOCTOR

... and whatever is causing these mutations is  not from outer space. it's more likely just an isolated biological pheno ... pheno ... ph ... ph ... ph ... Suddenly the DOCTOR'S head starts to jerk from side to si Everyone looks on, not knowing how to react.  As the DOCT begins to move in short bursts, like a broken robot, he fixes his gaze upon the pretty secretary across the table
From the bottom of the huge spacecraft, a metal tube emer starts to drill through the roof of the Pentagon.
The DOCTOR starts to shake violently as he stares at the secretary. DOCTOR

Pretty ... pretty ... p ... p ... Suddenly he lunges at her, sliding across the table. As the DOCTOR struggles with the terrified girl, the came pans up to the ceiling, where the metal tube from the spa drills through.  Descending upon them, it sucks them up i DOCTOR
Aaarrgghh! SECRETARY
Eeeeeek!

A metallic robot holding a clipboard, is standing in fron a large glass receiving jar, as DOCTOR ANRAK comes throug the tube and lands in the jar.  As soon as the DOCTOR'S f hit the bottom of the jar, the DOCTOR breaks into a lot o small metallic parts. ROBOT (Mechanical voice)

Oh, nice job.  How am I supposed to fix this guy?  He's fucked. ZEKE and EDSEL, two alien space-pilots, are standing near at the control console.  They look like big furry orange on stilts, with arms coming out of the sider. ZEKE (to Edsel)
I guess we turned it up a little too high. EDSEL (to Robot)
Sorry, man. ROBOT
You're sorry?  What about  me
I've gotta put this asshole back together. Suddenly the pretty secretary comes through the tube and in the jar.  She's a little mussed up, but okay. GLORIA
(gasp)  Where am I? ROBOT (staring)
Hey, who's the chick? GLORIA
Well look at my clothes! Who's gonna pay for the dry cleaning?  And where am I? I demand that you return me to my office immediately. ROBOT
Too late - molecular instability zone around spacecraft. You cannot leave. GLORIA (to Zeke)
What?!  Is he kidding? ZEKE
Uh ... He looks at the ROBOT, who winks at him. ZEKE
... oh yeah.  Instability zone. You're stuck here. ZEKE and EDSEL try to keep straight faces. GLORIA (stunned)
But I have to be at my parents for dinner tonight.  And my gynecologist appointment is on Wednesday. ROBOT
Not anymore.  Would you, ah, like a drink? (leading her away) You'll feel better after a glass of fresh blo-aak. They disappear down a corridor. GLORIA (V.O.)
Do you have any diet soda?
EDSEL (to Zeke)
Ah, typical robot.  The first Earth-chick we see in ten years, and he's gotta make a play for her. EDSEL jams the gearshift into 'D' for Drive, and the ship lifts away from Earth. ZEKE
Hey, do we have any of that Plutonian Nyborg left? EDSEL
Uh, yeah.  Just one bag.  Uh, it's in the transmitter compartment. ZEKE

Uh, thanks man. ZEKE opens a hatch and pulls out a double-spouted plastic bag on wheels the size of a steamer-trunk.  It is full of white powder. He pours two fifteen-foot lines of powder onto the floor. Then, he pauses. ZEKE (surveying the lines)
Oh great.  Think this is enough? EDSEL (thinking)
Uhh ... nah.  Go for broke. ZEKE

Good thinking, man. As he resumes pouring, ZEKE begins singing to himself in alien tongue.  When the lines are poured, they both stand the start of the trail of white powder, and part their ha to reveal nostrils hidden in their foreheads. ZEKE & EDSEL

Nose dive! They both start to criss-cross the room, inhaling the whi powder like vaccuum cleaners.  As they happily snort the Nyborg, the camera pans back to the glass receiving jar, moves down through the broken pieces of DOCTOR ANRAK.  Re his lifeless face, the camera moves around to the back of head.  Through the shattered metal we can see a green bal glowing inside ANRAK'S skullpiece.
As the round spaceship moves through space, a group of asteroids approach and whip past.  Up ahead, a red sun turns white and goes super-nova. EDSEL (V.O.)
Oh, wow ... good Nyborg!
GLORIA PEARLMAN and the ROBOT are lying in bed, naked. They have just finished making love.  She is smoking a ci GLORIA (glazed)
That was incredible.  I've never felt anything like it. ROBOT
Oh great.  I have been programmed to be fully proficient in sexual activities. Do you want to go steady? GLORIA
Gee, I don't know.  I already have a boyfriend. ROBOT
Ah, what he does not know will not hurt him.

ZEKE and EDSEL are sitting at the controls, staring wide- out into space.  They are obviously stoned.  Suddenly a b rings and the communicator screen lights up.  A serious o face appears on it. OFFICER ON SCREEN
Mothership calling starcruiser Alpha ... Mothership calling starcruiser Alpha ... ZEKE looks over at the screen and then shouts into it. ZEKE
Whaddyawant, man? OFFICER ON SCREEN
Mothership calling Starcruiser Alpha ... EDSEL (to Zeke)
You gotta use the microphone. ZEKE
Oh yeah. (shouts into microphone) Whaddyawant man? OFFICER
Now listen, idiot.  Do I have to tell you eight hundred times?  You don't call me " man "!  You call me
Com-Op Officer Blix ". Now is that perfectly clear? ZEKE (into mike)
Yeah, sure.  Whaddyawant, man? OFFICER (disgruntled)

You are to return immediately to the Mother Ship and pick up a humanoid civilian.  Your orders are to escort him to the Interplanetary Tribunal Courtroom so that he can testify at the trial of Lincoln Sternn.  And make it snappy! The screen goes blank. EDSEL
Wow!  They finally got Sternn. ZEKE
It's about time.  Hang on, man. Here we go. ZEKE jams the gearshift into hyper-drive.
The round spaceship blasts forward at ten times the speed of light.
ZEKE and EDSEL'S round spacecraft looks like an apple heading toward a freight train as it approaches the enormous mother-ship.

An ashtray full of roaches sits on the console.  ZEKE is at the controls with a joint in his mouth.  He is swaying back and forth, eyes glazed.  Beside him, EDSEL watches the mothership getting closer. EDSEL (to Zeke)
You okay to land this thing? ZEKE
No problem, man.
Huge red arrows point the way through the ten-mile wide landing area as the round spaceship glides in. EDSEL (V.O.)
I think you're goin' a little high, man. ZEKE (V.O.)

It's okay, man.  If there's one thing I know, it's how to drive when I'm stoned.  It's like, you know your perspective's fucked, so you just gotta let your hands work the controls as if you're straight. The round ship rams directly into a wall, and crashes dow skidding to a stop in front of the loading bay. EDSEL (V.O.)
Oh, wow, good landing, man. ZEKE (V.O.)
Thanks.

ZEKE and EDSEL press a button to open the hatch doors. As the door opens we see two metallic Regolian guards waiting on the other side.  Between them stands a small, shabbily-dressed humanoid with a crooked jaw and cauliflower ears.  This is HANOVER FISTE. REGOLIAN GUARD (to Zeke and Edsel)
This man is to be delivered to the, clik, Interplanetary Tribunal, Courtroom #3, clik, Galaxy versus Lincoln Sternn. Thenk yew.  Clik. The guards wheel away. FISTE (meekly)
Ah, hello.
ZEKE and EDSEL escort FISTE down the corridor. EDSEL (to Fiste)
Umm, you're gonna testify at Sternn's trial? FISTE nods. ZEKE
They gotta give him at least, like, life. FISTE
Lincoln Sternn is a kind and honourable man. (camera pulls close to Fiste's face) He will be freed.
As the round spaceship journeys through space it passes t a fantastic space-scape of disembodied rock statues, and a magnificent graffiti-covered robot chained to an astero EDSEL (V.O.)
Y'know, I wish they'd clean this place up, man. ZEKE (V.O.)
Yeah.  It's like pig city out here. EDSEL (V.O.)
Yeah.
GLORIA is getting dressed as the ROBOT re-charges his ene paks. ROBOT
... but I don't understand.  We laugh together.  We care for each other.  We have highly proficient sex.  Why can't we get married? GLORIA
Look, we're different, okay?  Let's leave it at that.
The hatch opens, and GLORIA and the ROBOT walk through, still talking. GLORIA

... but mixed marriages just don't work.  What if you get tired of me and run off with a vibrator or something? As they move through the room, and out the other side, th pass FISTE, who is sitting quietly near the receiving jar hands folded.  Looking around, FISTE notices a green glow coming from the bottom of the jar.  He gets up, quietly o the jar, and pokes through the scrap robot parts. Finding the small green ball in ANRAK'S head, he pulls it out and looks at it.
ZEKE and EDSEL are sitting at the controls, driving caref FISTE, carrying the green ball, comes up and sits down be them. ZEKE
There it is, man.  I'm gonna hang a louie here. EDSEL (to Fiste)
Yeah, well it won't be long now.  Are you  sure you're gonna testify for Sternn. FISTE says nothing.  He just clutches the green ball and into space. ZEKE and EDSEL look at each other and shrug.

An enormous, brightly-lit, multi-level space station/cour floats into view, completely filling the screen.  ZEKE an EDSEL'S round spaceship is just a speck as it enters the approaching the mammoth structure.
The ship locks into the dock, and the exit hatch opens. GLORIA and the ROBOT come through first, ahead of ZEKE, E and FISTE. GLORIA
... alright, alright.  I'll marry you - but on one condition ... I want a Jewish wedding. ROBOT
A Jewish wedding!?!!!  But this is space .  95% of the population are robots. GLORIA
Well, find me a  robot -rabbi! ROBOT
Okay, okay! EDSEL
I give them six months, man. ZEKE

He doesn't even look Jewish! GLORIA and the ROBOT disappear around a corner as ZEKE an escort FISTE through the hatch.  FISTE is carrying the sm green ball. As they lead FISTE away, the camera pulls back, out throu a space-port, and moves along the outside of the slowly rotating space-station.  At the top, the camera zooms dow through a massive glass-domed ceiling and into a huge inter-galactic courtroom. Voices echo below us. PROSECUTOR
Are you Captain Lincoln F. Sternn? STERNN

I am. As we move down, we see square-jawed CAPTAIN STERNN, his shifty-eyed lawyer, and the cold Prosecutor all standing before the Judge. STERNN is smirking confidently as the Prosecutor reads fr a long page of charges. PROSECUTOR
Lincoln Sternn - you stand here accused of twelve counts of murder in the first degree  ... fourteen counts of armed theft of Federation property ...
The hostile humanoid and alien faces all stare at STERNN hateful, accusing eyes. PROSECUTOR (V.O.)
... twenty-two counts of piracy in high space ... eighteen counts of fraud ...
Mopping his brow, he looks nervously over to STERNN. PROSECUTOR (V.O.)
... thirty-seven counts of rape, and one moving violation.  How do you plead?
Smiling to himself, he nods, then gets serious. STERNN
Not guilty! LAWYER (whispers to Sternn)
Not guilty?!?  Are you  nuts
STERNN (whispers to lawyer)
It's okay, Charlie.  I got an angle. JUDGE (to Prosecutor)
Call the first witness! STERNN and his lawyer move to their seats. LAWYER (to Sternn)
But the Prosecutor's gotcha  cold
Yer as guilty as a cat in a goldfish bowl.
ZEKE and EDSEL enter with FISTE, and push their way to th front. PROSECUTOR
The Prosecution calls Hanover Fiste. GUARD #1
Calling Hanover Fiste! GUARD #2
Calling Hanover Fiste! GUARD #3
Calling Hanover Fiste! GUARD #4

Hanover Fiste! ZEKE and EDSEL sit down, while HANOVER FISTE, small and shabby, walks up to the witness stand, nervously clutchin the small green ball in his hand.  As he passes, STERNN a his lawyer continue to argue. LAWYER (pleading)
Lissen Sternn ... change the plea to guilty.  Throw yerself on the mercy of the court. STERNN
I told you, Charlie.  I got an angle. HANOVER FISTE is sworn in, as Sternn's lawyer begs. LAWYER
But the most we can hope for is to get ya buried in secrecy so yer grave don't get violated!  Plead  guilty
STERNN
Shut up, Charlie.  I got an  angle . LAWYER
What angle? STERNN (pointing to Fiste)
Him!
PROSECUTOR
State your name for the record. FISTE (fidgeting nervously with the green ball)
I am Hanover Fiste.
STERNN (winking to lawyer)
I promised him thirty-five thousand zuleks to testify on my behalf.
PROSECUTOR
You know the defendant, (pointing) Captain Sternn? FISTE
Yes, I know Captain Sternn.  And never did there live a kinder, more generous man.  He is an overflowing cup, filled with the very cream of human goodness ...
STERNN (to lawyer)
See?
FISTE
... in all the time I've known him, he's  never done  anything immoral ... (thinking) unless maybe the Pre-Schooler's Prostitute ring ...
They look at each other, shocked. STERNN & LAWYER
Huh?!?
FISTE (speaking gently)
... and he's ah, never done anything illegal ... (turning sharply) ... unless you count all the times he sold  dope disguised as a  nun

(reverting to meekness) He's always been a good, law-abiding citizen ... (shouting at himself) Awww, gimme a break!! (gentle again) ... of the Federation, and, and ... (going schizo) Shut Up!  Shut Up!  Shut Up! (gentle, but starting to sweat) ... a community-concious individual, ah, ah ... (rising in crazed anger)
(pointing as he screams) He's nothin' but a low-down, double-dealin', back-stabbin', larcenous, perverted  worm
STERNN and his lawyer look on, horrified, as FISTE'S body starts to grow. FISTE
Hangin's too  good for him!! New muscles tear through FISTE'S shabby clothes. FISTE
Burnin's too good for him!! Growing larger, he starts foaming at the mouth. STERNN
Hanover ... FISTE
He should be torn into little bitsy pieces and  buried alive
FISTE rams his hands down onto the Witness Stand, shatter it completely. STERNN
Hanover ... FISTE
I'll kill him! He hurls the Prosecutor aside, and moves towards STERNN w thundering footsteps. FISTE
Still growing, he rips apart the Judge's bench as he pass it.  Finally  he stands towering in rage over the terrifi STERNN. STERNN (to Fiste)

H-h-hey, Hanover ... n-now take it easy, Hanover, I'm sure we can talk this ov ... Instinctively, STERNN leaps back as FISTE'S giant hands c smashing down in the spot where STERNN stood.  The galler scatters screaming as STERNN runs for the door.  Slaverin FISTE thunders after him.  STERNN runs through the exit, bolting the door behind him.  FISTE follows, tearing the door apart, and bringing the entire courtroom wall down i the process.
Running down a hallway, STERNN passes a group of Regolian cops, who raise their weapons in an attempt to block the rampaging FISTE. REGOLIAN #1

Halt, clik, in the name of the Federation, clik.  Where is your corridor pass? (to other Regolians) Unco-operative humanoid, clik, blast him. They open fire, but FISTE is unstoppable.  Still growing, he grabs the Regolians's weapons, crunches them up and ea them. REGOLIAN #1

You are now in violation of Code 103-N-17, clik, paragraph A-64 ... unauthorized consumption of Federation property.  Please come quietly, clik, ... thenk yew. With a single clap of his enormous hands, FISTE crushes t Regolian's metal skulls together into an accordian the th of a dime.
He races through a metallic hallway, and ducks into a boi room, then down a long dark tunnel.  At the end of the tu STERNN comes to a dead-end, and stops to rest. STERNN
Oh, this looks good. FISTE
(growls) STERNN
Oh, duck under here ... FISTE
I'll get you!! STERNN
I think I'll turn  here
(runs, gasping) Come on feet, don't fail me now! FISTE
Sternn!!! STERNN
Uh oh ... (runs) Ah, gasp, ah whew, lost him! FISTE
STERNN
Okay, Hanover, you've had this coming! Taking a deep breath, STERNN reaches into his pocket, pul out a wad of bills, and counts them out as he hands them FISTE. STERNN
Let's see, thirty-three, thirty- four, thirty-five thousand zuleks. Thanks Hanover. FISTE (taking money)
S'nothin, boss. Counting his money, FISTE starts shrinking back to his normal size. STERNN
And Hanover ... FISTE
Yes? STERNN
Goodbye. STERNN pulls a lever, which opens up the floor below FIST who screams, falling out into space.  As FISTE slides out STERNN grabs the money from FISTE'S hand and smiles.

All is quiet across this vast expanse of rusted pipes and barren desert.  The silence is broken by a whistling soun gets louder and louder.  Then, thud! A green ball lands in the dirt in front of us.  Flutterin around it are HANOVER FISTE'S tattered clothes.  Then the burnt ashes of Hanover's body land in a small pile beside clothes.  Panning up we see TAARNA flying on her bird in distance.

She swoops down and flies through a maze of rusting pipes cables which look like the ramnants of an ancient power s Then she steers her bird through a hidden opening in the floor, and enters a magnificent  secret hideaway cut deep the rock.

Landing her bird on a circular slab of gleaming marble, T dismounts and walks over to a shimmering pool.  Here she and picking up a small gold pitcher, she pours an ancient over herself.  It shines and sparkles as it touches her s Then she steps into the water, where her body seems to sp even brighter. Finishing her sacred bath, she steps out and walks to a s wall.  When she touches it, a rock panel slides away to r a gold chest.  TAARNA opens it. Inside the chest lies a glistening set of armoured garmen so bright that TAARNA must shield her eyes for a moment. as she looks down at the armour, the voice of TAARAK THE DEFENDER comes into her head. TAARAK (V.O.)
To  defend - this is the Pact. but when life loses its value, and it taken for nought, then the Pact is ... to  avenge

Through a series of dissolves we see TAARNA'S hands sensu fitting the various metallic pieces over her firm body. we pull back to see her fully. Standing before us, glistening in the torch-light, she lo magnificent.  Reaching once more into the chest, TAARNA p out a golden sword.  As she holds it, it seems to vibrate almost buzzing in her hands.  Suddenly she swings it, sli cleanly through one of the stone torches on the rock wall the burning torch falls to the ground, TAARNA leaves.

From over our heads, TAARNA comes soaring past, her armou gleaming in the rays of the setting sun.  Below her, she sees a metallic holiday-town filled with barbarian soldie Drunken blue men fight in the streets, strange animals ru around loose, and dead or drunken bodies lie in the gutte Looking down, amidst the melee, she sees three winged cre tied up in front of a bar.  The camera zooms in on one of creature's saddlebags.  It has a silver medallion set int leather, identical to the one which TAARNA pried from the Elder's fingers.

Barbarian honky-tonk music fills the crowded room, as various barbarian soldiers sit drinking and fondling the bar-girls who are dressed in cheap, flashy metal outfits. Three of the blue barbarians are particularly drunk and rowdy as they push a non-barbarian down, dump a drink on head, laugh and kick him.

TAARNA walks in through the swinging silver and plexiglas doors, past the three soldiers kicking their victim.  She down at the bar. The three brutish blue soldiers finish stomping the man a walk over to the bar, crowding close around TAARNA. BARBARIAN #1
Hey, look.  A new one. (to Taarna) Where you from, baby? TAARNA ignores him. BARBARIAN #2
Doesn't talk much, does she ? BARBARIAN #3
She doesn't have to talk for what I want to do with her.
It slowly moves down to her sword, and unclips the safety
BARBARIAN #3
(running his hand across her breastplate) C'mon baby, let's see what's under there. BARBARIAN #1
(starting to undo her breastplate) Yeah, let's have a look. Taarna slowly stands up, pushing their hands away, and ta a step back. BARBARIAN #2
Heey, she's tough. BARBARIAN #3
Maybe she wants to fight? They all laugh. BARBARIAN #1

... or maybe she wants to take us  all on? Still laughing, they move towards her. In a blinding flash, TAARNA draws her golden sword, and w it like a Samurai master, slices off all three of their h In an instant, the sword is back in its sheath. The barbarian's heads stop laughing as they fall to the g The music stops, and everyone in the bar stares at TAARNA Stepping over the bodies, TAARNA walks up to the bartende pulls out the parchment picture of the glowing mountains, shows it to him.  The bartender looks at it carefully, th points out the window. BARTENDER
Beyond the oasis. TAARNA nods and leaves.
His eyes start to turn green.  The camera gets closer and closer to his glowing eyes, until the green glow turns in the image of a ball, lying in the ground, in AUSTIN'S hol
AUSTIN is crouched over the machine turning several knobs trying to make the ball move.  Nothing happens. AUSTIN (to himself)

Hmmm ... must be jammed. Frustrated, AUSTIN picks up a flashlight, opens up a comp underneath the control knobs, and takes a look inside.  W AUSTIN fiddles inside the machine, we see two hands appea the holograph screen and pick up the green ball.  AUSTIN over to the holograph and notices. AUSTIN
Where'd it go?
As the hands cradle the green ball, the camera pulls back to reveal a skinny, unco-ordinated boy wearing thick eyeg carrying the sphere across his backyard.  This is DAN. DAN (V.O.)

It all started when I found the green meteorite.  I read in Farraday's "Life of the Planets" that smaller ones like this are supposed to burn up when they enter the atmosphere, but for some reason this one didn't ... DAN carries the ball into a typical small-town house.

As the narration continues, we follow two red wires down from the T.V. antenna, along the roof, and into DAN'S att window.  The wires run through a bucket of water and are up to some electronic parts on DAN'S desk. DAN (V.O.)

... so I brought it up to my room, stuck it in my rock collection and forgot about it.  I was experimenting with natural electricity ... The camera pans around the room to show various displays DAN'S scientific tinkering - blue-ribbon science projects transparent models of a man and a woman showing all inter organs, and many books. In the corner, the green ball sits in DAN'S rock collecti At his desk, DAN impatiently shuffles through the dusty p of an old scientific journal. DAN (V.O.)
... and with the storm warnings up, I figured maybe tonight I'd hit the jackpot.  All I needed was a little juice. He looks out the window at the gathering storm.
Crackling from the sky, a bolt of lightning strikes the television antenna and surges along the wires into the at
The lightning flashes into DAN'S apparatus, lighting it u brightly. DAN

It works! Suddenly, an electric arc jumps from the bucket of water and crosses the room to join with thw ball on his shelf. Caught in the middle, DAN begins to glow green. DAN (looking at his green arms)
Oh Jesus! The electrical field opens up a shimmering gateway into a universe and DAN de-materializes.
We float in darkness for a moment as black shapeless imag zoom past. DAN (V.O.)

I felt like I was nothing - just atoms floating in the darkness ... Then, tiny beams of light join to form a glow in the corn of the screen. The glow gets brighter and starts moving s around the screen.  Now, we can make out some of the imag whipping past - a half-formed hand, pages of a book, a cr pyramid, a green ball. DAN (V.O.)

Then, a body started to re-form around me.  Only it wasn't my body - this one had muscles. Sturdy muscular parts begin to materialize around the mov light.  They join up with each other to form a powerfully human figure. Finally a man's face takes shape, and as it forms, eveyth gets brighter and clearer. DAN (V.O.)

It was a great body, but I wasn't too crazy about the face. The powerful figure, DEN, turns slowly as he floats and b to look at his hands and arms.  Moving his mouth, he spea a new voice - deep and powerful. DEN (feeling head)
Hmmm ... no hair. Suddenly, the background explodes into fields of radiant as the body accelerates away from us and passes through a shimmering gateway.

DEN, strong, masculine and hairless, materializes cradled the hand of a huge stone idol.  He is naked and unconscio Above him, the glowing green ball is held in the idol's o hand. The camera pulls back to show that the idol is standing o deck, stop a huge, truncated pyramid.  The deck forms a w around a swirling pool of green water. Kneeling all around the seething pool, are lizard-men, we priest's robes.  Two of them stand beside a glass coffin. the coffin, lies a naked girl, bound and gagged. PRIESTS (chanting softly)
Uluhtec, Ulutec ... Directly in fron of the idol, a regal-looking QUEEN, wear a revealing velvet cloak, is praying to the raging water. QUEEN
By the powers of the glowing Loc-Nar placed in your idol's hand, I demand you come forth, Uluhtec! The waters of the sacrifical pool rage more violently and a low rumble is heard far below.
The green ball, (Loc-Nar), glows brightly as DEN opens hi looks down and notices his enormous genitals. DEN
Hmmm ... big! Seeing an animal-skin hanging from the idol, he rips off piece and wraps it around himself. DAN (V.O.)
There was no way I was gonna walk around this place with my dork hangin' out! Suitably covered, he surveys the ritual taking place belo DAN (V.O.)
Wow!  This looked like something right out of the Ten Commandments.
The QUEEN is kneeling before the seething water. QUEEN

Grant me your strength in return for a living mortal sacrifice!  It has been ordained.  Come forth Uluhtec! I demand it! Two lizard priests remove the terrified girl from the gla case and hold her out over the swirling water.  The QUEEN nods and the two priests drop her in.
Seeing the girl struggle in the water, DEN'S eyes grow wi DAN (V.O.)
What'd they do  that for? He stands and dives into the raging pool, swimming powerf towards the drowning girl.

Reaching her, DEN grabs the girl's  bound ankles, hooks t over his head and drags her through a decayed hole in the underwater wall.  Inside a stone tunnel, they are swept a by the current. DAN (V.O.)
Normally, I'd be dead by now.  I kept thinking I was going to run out of air, but my new body worked great.  I just hoped her body was working as good as mine.
DEN and the girl are washed out into a pond at the center a beautiful field of lilies.  He pulls her out of the wat unconscious.  As he unties her, she begins to stir. GIRL
Thank you. She takes DEN'S hand and lies back in the flower, her beautiful breasts exposed in the sunlight. DAN (V.O.)
She had the most beautiful eyes. I wanted to make some conversation but I found my new self asking the same old stupid questions. DEN
Are you from around here? GIRL
Well, you may not believe this, but I'm from another world - from a place called Earth. DEN
Earth?  I too am from Earth. How did you get here? GIRL

My name is Katherine Wells, and I'm from the British colony of Gibraltar.  Time makes no diff- erence here, but there it was the summer of 1892.  It was evening - I'd gone for a walk on the cliffs when suddenly a sphere fell from the sky.  Following its glow, I came to a shining gate made out of light.  Unable to resist, I stepped through it and awoke in this world.  There I was thin and weakly, fit only to stay indoors. (she stands up) But here, somehow I am stronger, more alive, (she stretches seductively) ... more fully a woman. DAN (V.O.)
You're not kidding. DEN (standing)

I, too seem better equipped on this world. (he holds out his arm) My arms are more powerful. (strecthes his fingers) Even my fingers seem to hold great strength. KATHERINE walks up close to DEN, takes his hand and touch the fingers to her breast. KATHERINE
You saved my life.  I have no reward to give you, but if any part of me pleases your senses - I would give it willingly. She circles her nipple with his baby finger. DAN (V.O.)

Wow!  This was  great !  There was no way I'd get a chick like this back on Earth.  I mean,  look at her!! Taking KATHERINE in his arms, DEN lays her down on a bed flowers and begins to tenderly make love to her. DAN (V.O.)

There was only one problem ... A spiked boot appears in the frame.  The camera pans up t show a large, ugly hairy beast-man standing over DEN and KATHERINE. The camera then pulls back to reveal the entwined couple, completely surrounded by a horde of grim, bestial warrior DAN (V.O.
I don't know who these jerks were, but they sure picked a bad time to show up ... The ugly beast-men grab DEN and KATHERINE as we;
The beast-Captain keeps his machine gun trained on DEN as the soldiers lead him into the cavernous room. DAN (V.O.)

They split us up and took me to this weird castle-type place. I wanted to find out where they'd taken Katherine, but none of these guys seemed to speak English. In the middle of the room there is a round stone pedestal with a throne carved into it.  On the throne sits ARD, a child-like ruler with a sadistic glint in his eye. ARD
They tell me you are Den of Earth, the one who dared to steal the female sacrifice from the Queen. DAN (V.O.)
This guy was a shrimp so I figured I'd play it tough. DEN
Where is the girl? ARD
I am Ard - supreme leader of the revolution and the next ruler of the world. DEN (tougher)
The girl!! ARD
Well, aren't we fierce? If you are truly as tough as you seem, then you will serve me well.  But first, a test. Guards!  Castrate him! DAN (V.O.)

Uh oh. Two bestial guards approach from behind, brandishing curv short-swords.  DEN turns instinctively, dodges the first and delivers a bone-shattering elbow to the beast's head, crushing his skull. Spinning with his own momentum, DEN throws a rock-hard fi into the second guard's chest, snapping his rib-cage and sending him flying across the room. Without pausing, the bald muscleman grabs the nearby beas Captain and lifts him into the air by his machine-gun.  T Captain hangs on as DEN twists the gun, butts it into the creature's groin and then drives the weapon through the Captain's jaw. The creature crumples, leaving DEN with the gun. DAN (V.O.)
Boy!  I was pretty good at this stuff. ARD
Excellent.  You are worthy to serve me. DEN (aiming machine-gun at him)
Give me the girl or die. ARD (taking it lightly)
Well, if I have a choice, I'll take death. DEN
So be it. DEN fires, spraying a row of bullets across ARD'S body. bullets blast big yellow holes in ARD'S chest, but there no blood.  ARD looks up and laughs. ARD
Ha ha ha!  You'll have to do better than that. As DEN looks on, ARD'S wounds miraculously close up and h themselves over. DAN (V.O.)
I could see why they made this guy their leader. ARD (standing up)
... but if you're really interested in the girl; I've had her encased in glass. ARD pulls the velvet covering off of a glass box to revea KATHERINE, unconscious, sealed inside. DEN
She's dead. ARD
Actually no.  She's sleeping, but only I can awaken her. DEN
What do you want of me? ARD
I want you to steal the sacred Loc-Nar. DEN
What is this Loc-Nar? ARD

The Queen's glowing sphere, you fool.  The sacrifice to Uluhtec can only be performed by the possessor of the sacret Loc-Nar. (calling out) Norl! NORL, a huge gorilla-man, in a purple cloak, steps forwar ARD (to Den)
This is Norl, my bravest warrior. You will go with him to the Queen's castle and steal the Loc-Nar.  Then I will give you the girl. DEN
And if I refuse? ARD
If you refuse,  you die,  she dies, everybody dies. DAN (V.O.)
Sounded reasonable to me. DEN looks down at KATHERINE'S motionless body.

head_text.subj: RIVER BANKS NEAR THE QUEEN'S CASTLE

text: In the moonlight, DEN and NORL lead a squad of beast-warr armed with automatic weapons, along the river towards the castle. NORL (to Den)
Ssh.  Guard post ahead.  We must go underground. NORL lifts a rock to reveal an underground passageway. DAN (V.O.)
This guy Norl seemed to know what he was doing.  And, for a gorilla, his English wasn't half bad. DEN and the warriors enter the underground passage.
The group, carrying torches, moves along the dark tunnel. pass a bubble-window with shark-faced eels swimming on th side. NORL (to Den)
We're underneath the castle moat. DEN nods.  An ugly growl echoes through the tunnel up ahe the warriors freeze and murmur to each other in their own languages. DEN (to Norl)
What are they saying? NORL
They talk of the savage beast who prowls these catacombs with a fierce hunger and sharp teeth ... (gestures) six inches long. A dog-faced warrior shakes his head and says something to NORL
Sorry ... (indicating)

sixteen inches long. Suddenly, a savage beast appears and chomps his long, raz teeth into one of the warriors at the end of the line.  D and the remaining warriors run on through the tunnel as, them, the monster pulls his victim apart.
DEN, NORL, and the remaining warriors arrive at a door in rock wall. NORL (to Den)

Now we separate.  You and Korg take this door into the Queen's quarters.    The rest of us will move through the walls and enter her chamber from the other side. Whoever gets the Loc-Nar first will return it to Ard.  Good luck, Den. DEN nods, puts out his torch and carefully opens the door NORL moves off.
DEN and KORG silently enter.  Across the dark room, the glow of the green ball casts a pale light. KORG (whispers and points)
Loc-Nar. DAN (V.O.)
Wow!  It was just like the ball I dug up in my back yard. They tip-toe towards it. DAN (V.O.)

As I saw the Loc-Nar's glow I had this real funny feeling.  All by themselves, my hands reached forward to touch it.  But the Loc-Nar moved out of the way. Instead, my hands felt something else - warm flesh.  Then the lights came on. In the brightly lit room, DEN is standing before the beau semi-clad QUEEN, and holding her firm, naked breasts in h Looking around, he sees that he and KONG are surrounded b brigade of the Queen's ugly guards, swords raised. DAN (V.O.)
Talk about embarassing! QUEEN (smiling)

Kill them. The Queen's guards attack with battle-axes, clubs and swo As DEN knees one in the groin and swings his gun into ano face, four of the guards surround KORG and club his brain But DEN, still going strong, throws two guards into the w and heaves a third out the window.  As the QUEEN watches glee, more guards rush into the room and DEN is finally o powered and held down.  The Captain of the guards places knife against Den's throat. CAPTAIN
Can I slit his throat, your Majesty? The QUEEN, eyeing Den's magnificent body, sighs. QUEEN
Yes, slit his throat. CAPTAIN
Thank you, your Majesty. As the Captain presses his knife against Den's flesh, the QUEEN suddenly raises her hand. QUEEN (smiling)
Stop!  I have, ah, something better in mind. She takes Den's hand and leads him into an adjoining room the guards grumble to one another. GUARD #1
Jeez, not again. GUARD #2
This  always happens. CAPTAIN
Look, she's the Queen.  She can do whatever she wants. GUARD #2
Yeah, sure. GUARD #1
Sure.
The QUEEN stands before DEN, hands on her hips and a funn in her eye. QUEEN
If you please me, I may let you live. She smiles, and approaches DEN. DAN (V.O.)
Uh oh. DEN
What must I do? QUEEN
Satisfy my appetites. The QUEEN lets her cloak drop to the floor as she gets cl She is naked underneath. DAN (V.O.)
Wow!  Eighteen years of nuthin' and now, twice in one day.  What a place! QUEEN
Come with me. DEN
Mmmm. She steps forward and takes his hand, leading him towards bed.

DEN and the QUEEN are lying undressed on the enormous bed The QUEEN has a very contented look on her face.  DEN loo exhausted.  As the Neverwhere moon rises outside the cham window, the QUEEN slowly runs her hand over DEN'S bulging muscles. QUEEN (softly)
The rising moon climaxes our love, Den.  Is is a sign, a new beginning. DEN
Yes, a sign. DAN (V.O.)
I had no idea what she was talking about. QUEEN (stroking him)

Neverwhere is a troubled land, but together we could calm it. We could rule side by side. Your strength has brought great peace to my restless body.  It could bring great peace to all the troubled people of this land. DAN (V.O.)
I knew I was good, but I didn't know I was  that good. Suddenly the Captain and his guards burst through the doo CAPTAIN
Your Majesty!  The Loc-Nar is missing
stolen
The QUEEN jumps to her feet in a rage and points to DEN. QUEEN (screaming)
Fiend!  You make love to me while your accomplices steal the magic sphere!  Guards!  Take him! The guards grab DEN as the  QUEEN snatches one of their b spiked clubs. QUEEN (to guards)
Hold him still!  I will kill him  myself
DAN (V.O.)
Boy, was she pissed off! Heaving the guards aside, DEN breaks free and jumps out t chamber window.
DEN falls down, down into the swirling waters of the cast moat.
She is livid. QUEEN
Prepare the flying lizards. I want his head!
Pulling himself out of the moat, DEN knocks a guard off h leopard/horse and rides off.

ARD is kneeling at the edge of the sacrificial pool.  Bes him sits a long glass case wrapped in chains.  Through th chains we see KATHERINE trapped inside - fully conscious terrified.  Ard's bestial warriors stand all around carry torches and spears. Above them, the Loc-Nar sits glowing in the stone idol's ARD

By the power of the magic Loc-Nar placed in your idol's hands, I command you - come forth Uluhtec! The green water in the pool immediately begins to churn violently and leap into the air.  A bolt of lightning crackles in the sky.

DEN is racing across the barren desert on his leopard/hor Visible in the distance is the outline of the huge, trunc pyramid where he first saved KATHERINE. As he rides, he sees the green glow of the Loc-Nar, spark in the glass surfaces of the coffin in front of it. DEN (to himself)
Katherine! He spurs his leopard/horse on into the night.

head_text.subj: ANOTHER PART OF THE NEVERWHERE DESERT

text: The QUEEN, riding a flying lizard, leads her army in purs of DEN. SOLDIER (pointing)
There he is, your Majesty!
Up ahead, silhouetted in the moonlight, she sees DEN, rid the steps of the pyramid.  The camera pans to the green g atop the torch-lit pyramid. QUEEN (V.O.)
The Loc-Nar!
QUEEN (shouting to her men)
Faster!  To the pyramid! She whips her lizard harder.
ARD is incanting to the raging water while two hooded mon stand beside him, holding the struggling KATHERINE out ov the pool. ARD

Here is your sacrifice, Uluhtec. Now, give me your power! (to monks) Throw her in. Chanting the name "Uluhtec", the two monks start to throw the girl in when suddenly a third monk leaps forward and grabs her, kicking the other two monks into the water. The intruder's hood falls away and his bald head gleams i moonlight. DEN
Katherine! KATHERINE
Den! ARD
No!  You'll ruin everything! ARD jumps up and runs toward the Loc-Nar, perched in the idol's hand.  Grabbing it, ARD holds the glowing ball abo ARD (to his guards)
Kill them!  Kill them both! Suddenly, a hand leaps out of the darkness, gripping the Loc-Nar just above Ard's hand - it is the QUEEN. QUEEN
The Loc-Nar is mine! ARD (struggling)
Stupid bitch!  Get away from me! As ARD and the QUEEN fight over the Loc-Nar, the Queen's pour in and battle with Ard's soldiers.  Thunder roars ov
Holding KATHERINE in one arm, DEN smashes a nearby soldie grabs the beast's spear.  With the battle raging all arou him, DEN looks up at the sky.
Lightning crackles, illuminating the night with electrici

DEN reaches down, picks up the long chain that was wrappe the glass case and attaches one end to his spear.  He kic other end into the raging water, then heaves the spear with all his might into the head of the stone idol. In the same instant, a bolt of lightning fires down from striking the idol full force.  The lightning bolt travels the spear and down the chain, into the water.  Suddenly, electrical energy arcs across to join with the Loc-Nar. Holding onto the Loc-Nar, ARD and the QUEEN begin to glow then de-materialize into a shimmering dimensional warp. troops stop fighting and look on in amazement, until all that remains is the glowing Loc-Nar, hanging in mid-air. KATHERINE (to Den)
Where did they go? DEN
They are gone.  That is all that matters. DAN (V.O.)
They probably went back to Earth. Boy, will Mom be surprised. Suddenly, the Loc-Nar falls to the ground at Den's feet. KATHERINE (looking down)
The Loc-Nar ... you could have the power of Uluhtec.  You could be ruler over all these people. DEN (looking over the throng)
Forget it. In a single powerful leap, DEN, carrying KATHERINE, bound onto the Queen's flying lizard and they fly off.  The ama watch for a moment, then shrug and resume fighting.
KATHERINE clings to DEN as they fly. KATHERINE
Oh, but Den, with the Loc-Nar you could have returned to Earth. DEN
I like it better here. The lizard banks sharply away from us and carries them in distance. DAN (V.O.)
On Earth, I'm nobody.  But here, I am

The camera pans down the stone statue to the glowing sphe which lies abandoned on the ground.  The soldiers are gon we watch, time begins to accelerate and the Neverwhere Py ages and crumbles all around the green ball.  The earth h and shifts, and dense vegetarian grows up through the cra the ground. A prehistoric man walks up and sees the glowing ball unde Fascinated, he picks it up and looks at it, as the foot o Tyrannosaurus Rex comes down, crushing him. Time advances again as the dinosaur becomes a skeleton, a a Biblical tent-community grows up around the ball.  In t fire-light, the Nomadic tribesmen are watering their anim when one of the camels paws at the ground, uncovering the ball.  Scared, the camel struggles and trys to break its Out of nowhere a Roman Legion attacks, slaughtering the t Time accelerates again, and the conquering Romans build a placing the green ball in the head of a golden idol.  The Romans grow fat and debauched, while slave-girls feed the As the ball glows, the temple crashes down around the deb Romans, covering them and the green ball in rubble. Over the ruins of the temple, a succession of primitive m clay huts evolve into the thatched-roof cottages of a Med village. A Medieval stone-cutter finds the ball, and mortars it in his stones as he builds a water well in the centre of the Satisfied with his work, he lowers the bucket to draw him a drink.  Behind him, an  ox-cart comes roaring around a The axle breaks and a heavy wooden wheel careens along, s the stone-cutter in the back and knocking him into the we Time advances once more as the Medieval village grows and transforms into a Victorian-style town.  It is evening, a the stone well now sits under a gazebo at the centre of a lit village green. A fancy carriage carrying a Victorian gentleman passes by circles the green. Moving in through a window across the street, we see a se looking woman dressing herself in black garters and lace. is intercut with the carriage circling the green, until t woman, who looks like a high-class harlot, finishes dress leaves her room.  Crossing the street, she walks up to th and leans provocatively up against the well. The gentleman gets out of his carriage, approaches the wo and propositions her.  She smiles, touches, and teases hi pan down their legs to the green ball glowing in the well Suddenly red blood begins to drip over the ball, and the body falls to the ground.  The camera pans up to the well where the gentleman is washing the blood from his hands. As time begins to move forward again, the man ages and ho away, as the well crumbles and cheap turn-of-the-century housing grows up, covering the green ball.  The town beco dirtier and blacker, and smokestacks blow soot into the m sky.  Almost on cue, the doors of the houses open, and gr coal-miners emerge, shuffling through the filthy streets their way to work. The camera pans down to a drain in the gutter.  A rat app Panning back up, the street is now empty.  A bell is hear ringing, and a horse-drawn Red Cross cart pulls around a and into view.  Masked workers follow the cart.  One ring the bell, while the others pull corpses from the doorways load them into the cart.  The gutters and windowsills are full of rats.  Time advances again and the buildings beco deserted derelicts.  Their decaying timbers groan under t weight. A support snaps, and one of the buildings starts to colla Falling amidst the crumbling plaster and rotting wood is glowing green ball.  As the ball hits the ground, it is c over by rubble. The rubble becomes bleached by the hot sun and the landsc grows drier.  Sand blows all around, covering over everyt As the sandstorm clears, the entire terrain is nothing bu desert.  In the distance we can see a group of people wal

The people appears to be a band of aboriginal workmen, ca futuristic laser-shovels over their shoulders.  They are a goateed archaeologist with an elaborate metal detector. he walks, his detector starts bleeping.  He points to a s on the ground, and the natives start digging with their l shovels. One of the workers finds something. WORKER

Kuma!  Kuma!  Kuma! The archaeologist waves the workers away and directs a tr driven shovel-sifter up to the spot.  The shovel-sifter d in and pulls up a large chunk of desert.  When the sand h sifted out, we see the tarnished Loc-Nar in the machine's It is not glowing.  The machine swivels, and a native for plucks the Loc-Nar from the shovel-sifter's teeth. As the foreman touches it, the Loc-Nar starts glowing bri The foreman's hands turn green.  He looks at his green ha then he looks over to the archaeologist.  Suddenly the fo entire body glows green, and crumbles into dust. The archaeologist and the natives stare in horror at the glowing Loc-Nar, lying in the pile of green dust.

The camera comes down from high above the city.  The gene shape and outline of New York looks familiar, but as we g closer we sense that something is different.  Fires are burning in various locations below us, and intermittent gunshots become audible as the narration begins. HARRY (V.O.)

Yeah, New York, big deal.  Scum-centre of the world. Moving down through the skyscrapers, the city gets dirtie slummier.  We pass a dead man hanging from a tenement clo Below us, scruffy children dodge traffic as they play gyr in the garbage-filled street. HARRY (V.O.)

... and now they're talking about letting in low-lifes from other planets, too. Under the narration, the camera turns a corner and zooms through the roof of a parked taxicab.  It stops full fram the newspaper held in the cabdriver's hands.  A slow pan the front page reveals that the paper is the New York Tim July 6, 2031 One headline reads: "400,000 Traffic Deaths Over Holiday Another reads: "Venus Declared 73rd State". The camera stops on a headline reading: "Professor Discov Ancient Relic --- to be shown in N.Y. Museum". There is an accompanying photo of the goateed archaeologi his beautiful daughter standing beside a glass and metal containing the Loc-Nar. A knocking is heard on the cab's window, and the driver t down the newspaper. YOUNG MAN (from outside)
You free? HARRY
Yeah.  Get in. (V.O.)
My name's Harry Canyon.  I drive a cab. He flips a switch which unlocks the rear door.

The young man climbs into the back seat and closes the do Harry's yellow Checker cab pulls out into traffic.  The vehicle looks pretty normal except for some vaguely futur chrome panels cut into the sides, and thicker, deeper bum
Harry slides open the plexiglass shields separating him f his passenger. HARRY
Where to, pal? YOUNG MAN
The U.N. Building. HARRY

The U.N. Building.  What a joke. Used to be a nice place until they turned it into low rent housing. Now it's a dump.  I wouldn't live there if you paid me. He switches on the car radio.  The music plays as Harry's cab passes various time-altered New York landmarks; a gra -covered Empire State Building - windows all boarded up, decrepit Lincoln Centre, the marquis reading "Continuous Sex Show, Also Inter-Planetary Mud-Wrestling", new ultra- buildings crammed between half-destroyed Wall Street offi buildings, garbage everywhere. Inside the cab, the YOUNG MAN pulls a gun out of his jack sticks his arm through the opening in the plexi-glass shi and holds the gun to Harry's head. YOUNG MAN
Okay sucker, hand over your cash, now! HARRY (V.O.)

This city is really going to the dogs. Harry's foot stretches forward and pushes a footswitch. A buzzing is heard, and the young man's body suddenly dematerializes.  The gun which he held at Harry's head falls to the seat beside HARRY, who picks it up and tosse into the glove compartment, beside all sorts of other fut guns and weapons. HARRY (V.O.)
Stupid asshole.  Nobody touches me unless I want 'em to.

The camera is close-up on the illustrated banner over the entrance.  The banner reads; "Treasures of the Loc-Nar - July 8th". We pan down to the museum doors, as a man's body comes cr through the plate glass and sprawls forward, cut and blee It is the goateed professor from the desert.  His daughte runs out behind him, ripping her clothes on the broken gl
Father!
Run! The girl takes off down the museum stairs as men with las guns come out and start firing.  A fat, evil-looking man bends down and grabs the professor's head, jerking it up.
(to henchmen) He's dead.  Get the girl! The girl, clothes torn, runs out into the street, just as Harry's cab comes cruising by.  She runs alongside, pound on the window.
(to Harry) Help me, please!! A laser shot narrowly misses her and blasts Harry's side- HARRY flips the switch, unlocking the passenger door, and her in.
Normally my rule is "Don't get involved", but something about this dame got to me. She dives in the back and HARRY floors it.  The cab screa away as Laser-shots land all around.
(in shock, breathless) The Loc-Nar ... they wanted it ... but my father wouldn't tell them ... now I'm the only one ...
(interupting) Relax sister.  There's a cop station up here.  You can ... HARRY looks at her in the rear-view mirror.  The girl has
Just what I needed ... guess I'm a sucker for a pretty face.

The police station is an all-metal building with no windo A plaque on thr front reads "N.Y. POLICE - 52nd DIVISION" Harry's cab pulls up.  He gets out, carries the unconscio GIRL up to the front door, and pushes a buzzer.
(over intercom) Police.  Whaddya want?
I wanna report a murder.
(over intercom) So what else is new?

You gonna let me in or what? A buzzer sounds and the door slides open.  HARRY carries GIRL in and heads across the room toward the main desk. he walks he passes cops using a strange metal detector/va cleaner to suck dangerous weapons from a pair of suspects of weapons can be seen in the machine's transparent belly
Okay, this guy's clean - next. HARRY comes up to the front desk and starts to lay the gi down in a chair.
(to Harry) Before you go any further pal, I gotta tell you, it's cash up front.  A thousand bucks a day for a full investigation. Another thousand if the assailant is caught. Got it?
Yeah thanks ... He picks up the girl and turns to leave.
... for nuthin'!
(shouting after Harry) You think you can do better? Join one of the vigilante groups. There's a list of 'em outside.
HARRY, carrying the GIRL, comes out of the police station a patrol car screeches to a halt in front of him.  Two co emerge, dragging a green alien with four arms.
I tell you I'm an American citizen. I just lost my papers.
(to himself) Goddamn illegal aliens. HARRY heads toward his cab.

So here I was, stuck with this beautiful girl.  I knew she was gonna be nuthin' but trouble ... He looks around at the sleazy neighbourhood.  Every doorw and alley seems to have a rapist or thug lurking.
... but I didn't feel right just leaving her for the sickos.  I dunno, maybe I'm gettin' sentimental or something ...

This futuristic bachelor pad is constructed entirely of b coloured molden plastic.  Bowling trophies sit on a shelf underneath a neon "Buweiser" clock.  The place is a mess. HARRY carries the GIRL in, pushes the light button to "On and lays her down on the sofa.  As he takes off his jacke he looks down at the unconscious figure - her clothes tor in all the right places.  She moans and starts to come to
Where am I?
My place ... Walking over to a hi-tech plastic bar, HARRY pushes a but and a machine pours and mixes a drink.  He hands the GIRL glass.  She sits up and drinks.
(looking at Harry) They'd have killed me if it wasn't for you.
What'd they want to snuff you for?
